caseTitle: Basharat Ali Khan v. Muhammad Akbar
tagline: The prescribed elements of the service of a Talb-i-Ishhad notice are specific statutory requirements for the proof of service of notice of such Talb which demand has been construed to be a mandatory obligation of a preemptor. The failure by the vendee to highlight an obvious deficiency in the performance of Talb-i-Ishhad by the pre-emptor does not debar the former from pointing out the same at any stage of the proceedings to the Court. An omission whereby the Court has over-looked important material that would alter the decision in the case constitutes a fit ground for the grant of review under Article 188 of the Constitution.
